wikipedia_page.main: George Hill (21 October 1921 – 2002) was a Scottish football player and manager, who played for Dundee and East Fife in the 1940s and 1950s. Hill played for Dundee in the 1952 Scottish Cup Final, which they lost 4–0 to Motherwell. In 1956, Hill became the first manager of Montrose. He held this position until 1959, when he was succeeded by Norman Christie.
